intro: Psychotria laxiflora var. lepidota, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
